aaron_1.name: Aaron
aaron_1.bio: the eldest son of Amram and Jochebed, a daughter of Levi ( Exodus 6:20 ). Some explain the name as meaning mountaineer, others mountain of strength, illuminator. He was born in Egypt three years before his brother Moses, and a number of years after his sister Miriam ( Exodus 2:1 Exodus 2:4 ; 7:7 ).

abagtha_3.name: Abagtha
abagtha_3.bio: One of the seven eunuchs in Ahasuerus’s court ([Esther 1:10](/esth#Esth.1.10); [2:21](/esth#Esth.2.21)).

abda_4.name: Abda
abda_4.bio: The father of Adoniram, whom Solomon set over the tribute ([1 Kings 4:6](/1kgs#1Kgs.4.6)); i.e., the forced labour (R.V., “levy”).

abdeel_5.name: Abdeel
abdeel_5.bio: Servant of God, ([Jer. 36:26](/jer#Jer.36.26)), the father of Shelemiah.

abdiel_9.name: Abdiel
abdiel_9.bio: Servant of God, ([1 Chr. 5:15](/1chr#1Chr.5.15)), a Gadite chief.

abdon_10.name: Abdon (servile)
abdon_10.bio: The son of Hillel, a Pirathonite, the tenth judge of Israel ([Judg. 12:13-15](/judg#Judg.12.13)). He is probably the Bedan of [1 Sam.

abdon_11.name: Abdon
abdon_11.bio: One of the “sons” of Shashak ([1 Chr. 8:23](/1chr#1Chr.8.23)). This is the name also of a Levitical town of the Gershonites, in the tribe of Asher ([Josh.

abdon_12.name: Abdon (A judge of Israel for eight years (Judg)
abdon_12.bio: The first-born of Gibeon of the tribe of Benjamin ([1 Chr. 8:30](/1chr#1Chr.8.30); [9:36](/1chr#1Chr.9.36)).

abel_13.name: Abel
abel_13.bio: (Heb. Hebhel), a breath, or vanity, the second son of Adam and Eve. He was put to death by his brother Cain ([Gen.

abiah_15.name: Abiah (the Lord is my father)
abiah_15.bio: The second son of Samuel ([1 Sam. 8:2](/1sam#1Sam.8.2); [1 Chr. 6:28](/1chr#1Chr.6.28)).

abiah_17.name: Abiah (Wife of Hezron)
abiah_17.bio: One of the sons of Becher, the son of Benjamin ([1 Chr. 7:8](/1chr#1Chr.7.8)). “Abiah,” A.V.

abiathar_20.name: Abiathar
abiathar_20.bio: Father of abundance, or my father excels, the son of Ahimelech the high priest. He was the tenth high priest, and the fourth in descent from Eli. When his father was slain with the priests of Nob, he escaped, and bearing with him the ephod, he joined David, who was then in the cave of Adullam ([1 Sam.

abida_21.name: Abida
abida_21.bio: Or Abi’dah, father of knowledge; knowing, one of the five sons of Midian, who was the son of Abraham by Keturah ([1 Chr. 1:33](/1chr#1Chr.1.33)), and apparently the chief of an Arab tribe.

abidan_22.name: Abidan
abidan_22.bio: Father of judgment; judge, head of the tribe of Benjamin at the Exodus ([Num. 1:11](/num#Num.1.11); [2:22](/num#Num.2.22)).

abiel_18.name: Abiel (of David’s Mighty Men)
abiel_18.bio: An Arbathite, one of David’s warriors ([1 Chr. 11:32](/1chr#1Chr.11.32)); called also Abi-albon ([2 Sam. 23:31](/2sam#2Sam.23.31)).

abiel_23.name: Abiel (Kish)
abiel_23.bio: The son of Zeror and father of Ner, who was the grandfather of Saul ([1 Sam. 14:51](/1sam#1Sam.14.51); [1 Chr. 8:33](/1chr#1Chr.8.33); [9:39](/1chr#1Chr.9.39)).

abiezer_24.name: Abiezer (son of Ikkesh)
abiezer_24.bio: One of David’s thirty warriors ([2 Sam. 23:27](/2sam#2Sam.23.27); comp. [1 Chr.

abiezer_25.name: Abiezer (brother to to Ishhod and Mahlah)

abiezer_763.name: Abiezer (son of Joseph)
abiezer_763.bio: The second of the three sons of Hammoleketh, the sister of Gilead. He was the grandson of Manasseh ([1 Chr. 7:18](/1chr#1Chr.7.18)).

abigail_26.name: Abigail (Bible describes abigali as the name of a)
abigail_26.bio: The wife of the churlish Nabal, who dwelt in the district of Carmel ([1 Sam. 25:3](/1sam#1Sam.25.3)). She showed great prudence and delicate management at a critical period of her husband’s life.

abigail_27.name: Abigail (the father's joy)
abigail_27.bio: The sister of David, and wife of Jether an Ishmaelite ([1 Chr. 2:16](/1chr#1Chr.2.16), [17](/1chr#1Chr.2.17)). She was the mother of Amasa ([2 Sam.

abihail_30.name: Abihail (abihali is the son of huri)

abihail_31.name: Abihail (Father of Esther)
abihail_31.bio: The second wife of King Rehoboam ([2 Chr. 11:18](/2chr#2Chr.11.18)), a descendant of Eliab, David’s eldest brother.

abihail_32.name: Abihail (Father of Esther)
abihail_32.bio: The father of Esther and uncle of Mordecai ([Esther 2:15](/esth#Esth.2.15)).

abihu_33.name: Abihu
abihu_33.bio: Father of Him; i.e., “worshipper of God”, the second of the sons of Aaron ([Ex. 6:23](/exod#Exod.6.23); [Num. 3:2](/num#Num.3.2); [26:60](/num#Num.26.60); [1 Chr.

abihud_34.name: Abihud
abihud_34.bio: One of the sons of Bela, the son of Benjamin ([1 Chr. 8:3](/1chr#1Chr.8.3)); called also Ahihud (ver. 7).

abijah_14.name: Abijah (daughter of Zechariah)
abijah_14.bio: The daughter of Zechariah ([2 Chr. 29:1](/2chr#2Chr.29.1); comp. [Isa.

abijah_35.name: Abijah (son of Jeroboam)
abijah_35.bio: A son of Jeroboam, the first king of Israel. On account of his severe illness when a youth, his father sent his wife to consult the prophet Ahijah regarding his recovery. The prophet, though blind with old age, knew the wife of Jeroboam as soon as she approached, and under a divine impulse he announced to her that inasmuch as in Abijah alone of all the house of Jeroboam there was found “some good thing toward the Lord,” he only would come to his grave in peace.

abijah_36.name: Abijah (The Lord is my Father)
abijah_36.bio: A descendant of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, a chief of one of the twenty-four orders into which the priesthood was divided by David ([1 Chr. 24:10](/1chr#1Chr.24.10)). The order of Abijah was one of those which did not return from the Captivity ([Ezra 2:36-39](/ezra#Ezra.2.36); [Neh.

abijah_38.name: Abijah (son of Jeroboam)
abijah_38.bio: The son of Rehoboam, whom he succeeded on the throne of Judah ([1 Chr. 3:10](/1chr#1Chr.3.10)). He is also called Abijam ([1 Kings 14:31](/1kgs#1Kgs.14.31); [15:1-8](/1kgs#1Kgs.15.1)).

abimael_39.name: Abimael
abimael_39.bio: Father of Mael, one of the sons or descendants of Joktan, in Northern Arabia ([Gen. 10:28](/gen#Gen.10.28); [1 Chr. 1:22](/1chr#1Chr.1.22)).

abimelech_40.name: Abimelech (my father is king)
abimelech_40.bio: A king of Gerar in the time of Isaac, probably the son of the preceeding ([Gen. 26:1-22](/gen#Gen.26.1)). Isaac sought refuge in his territory during a famine, and there he acted a part with reference to his wife Rebekah similar to that of his father Abraham with reference to Sarah.

abimelech_41.name: Abimelech (A name borne by five Old Testament perso)
abimelech_41.bio: A son of Gideon ([Judg. 9:1](/judg#Judg.9.1)), who was proclaimed king after the death of his father ([Judg. 8:33-9:6](/judg#Judg.8.33)).

abinadab_43.name: Abinadab (noble.)
abinadab_43.bio: A Levite of Kirjath-jearim, in whose house the ark of the covenant was deposited after having been brought back from the land of the Philistines ([1 Sam. 7:1](/1sam#1Sam.7.1)). It remained there twenty years, till it was at length removed by David ([1 Sam.

abinadab_44.name: Abinadab (Second son of Jesse)
abinadab_44.bio: The second of the eight sons of Jesse ([1 Sam. 16:8](/1sam#1Sam.16.8)). He was with Saul in the campaign against the Philistines in which Goliath was slain ([1 Sam.

abinadab_45.name: Abinadab (he was married to Taphath daughter of So)
abinadab_45.bio: One of Solomon’s officers, who “provided victuals for the king and his household.” He presided, for this purpose, over the district of Dor ([1 Kings 4:11](/1kgs#1Kgs.4.11)).

abinadab_641.name: Abinadab (brother ofJonathan)
abinadab_641.bio: One of Saul’s sons, who peristed with his father in the battle of Gilboa ([1 Sam. 31:2](/1sam#1Sam.31.2); [1 Chr. 10:2](/1chr#1Chr.10.2)).

abinoam_46.name: Abinoam
abinoam_46.bio: Father of kindness, the father of Barak ([Judg. 4:6](/judg#Judg.4.6); [5:1](/judg#Judg.5.1)).

abiram_47.name: Abiram ([ Korah)
abiram_47.bio: One of the sons of Eliab, who joined Korah in the conspiracy against Moses and Aaron. He and all the conspirators, with their families and possessions (except the children of Korah), were swallowed up by an earthquake ([Num. 16:1-27](/num#Num.16.1); [26:9](/num#Num.26.9); [Ps.

abiram_48.name: Abiram (A member of the tribe of Reuben who)
abiram_48.bio: The eldest son of Hiel the Bethelite, who perished prematurely in consequence of his father’s undertaking to rebuild Jericho ([1 Kings 16:34](/1kgs#1Kgs.16.34)), according to the words of Joshua (6:26).

abishag_49.name: Abishag
abishag_49.bio: Father of (i.e., “given to”) error, a young woman of Shunem, distinguished for her beauty. She was chosen to minister to David in his old age. She became his wife ([1 Kings 1:3](/1kgs#1Kgs.1.3), [4](/1kgs#1Kgs.1.4), [15](/1kgs#1Kgs.1.15)).

abishai_50.name: Abishai
abishai_50.bio: Father of (i.e., “desirous of”) a gift, the eldest son of Zeruiah, David’s sister. He was the brother of Joab and Asahel ([2 Sam. 2:18](/2sam#2Sam.2.18); [1 Chr.

abishua_51.name: Abishua (the father of Bukki)
abishua_51.bio: The son of Phinehas the high priest ([1 Chr. 6:4](/1chr#1Chr.6.4), [5](/1chr#1Chr.6.5), [50](/1chr#1Chr.6.50); [Ezra 7:5](/ezra#Ezra.7.5)).

abishur_53.name: Abishur
abishur_53.bio: Father of the wall; i.e., “mason”, one of the two sons of Shammai of the tribe of Judah ([1 Chr. 2:28](/1chr#1Chr.2.28), [29](/1chr#1Chr.2.29)).

abital_54.name: Abital
abital_54.bio: Father of dew; i.e., “fresh”, David’s fifth wife ([2 Sam. 3:4](/2sam#2Sam.3.4)).

abitub_55.name: Abitub
abitub_55.bio: Father of goodness, a Benjamite ([1 Chr. 8:11](/1chr#1Chr.8.11)).

abiud_56.name: Abiud
abiud_56.bio: A descendant of Zerubbabel and father of Eliakim ([Matt. 1:13](/matt#Matt.1.13), “Abiud”); called also Juda ([Luke 3:26](/luke#Luke.3.26)), and Obadiah ([1 Chr. 3:21](/1chr#1Chr.3.21)).

abner_57.name: Abner
abner_57.bio: Father of light; i.e., “enlightening”, the son of Ner and uncle of Saul. He was commander-in-chief of Saul’s army ([1 Sam. 14:50](/1sam#1Sam.14.50); [17:55](/1sam#1Sam.17.55); [20:25](/1sam#1Sam.20.25)).

abraham_58.name: Abraham
abraham_58.bio: father of a multitude, son of Terah, named ( Genesis 11:27 ) before his older brothers Nahor and Haran, because he was the heir of the promises. Till the age of seventy, Abram sojourned among his kindred in his native country of Chaldea. He then, with his father and his family and household, quitted the city of Ur, in which he had hitherto dwelt, and went some 300 miles north to Haran, where he abode fifteen years.

absalom_59.name: Absalom
absalom_59.bio: Father of peace; i.e., “peaceful” David’s son by Maacah ([2 Sam. 3:3](/2sam#2Sam.3.3); comp. [1 Kings 1:6](/1kgs#1Kgs.1.6)).

achaicus_60.name: Achaicus
achaicus_60.bio: ([1 Cor. 16:17](/1cor#1Cor.16.17)), one of the members of the church of Corinth who, with Fortunatus and Stephanas, visited Paul while he was at Ephesus, for the purpose of consulting him on the affairs of the church. These three probably were the bearers of the letter from Corinth to the apostle to which he alludes in [1 Cor.

achan_61.name: Achan
achan_61.bio: Called also Achar, i.e., one who troubles ([1 Chr. 2:7](/1chr#1Chr.2.7)), in commemoration of his crime, which brought upon him an awful destruction ([Josh. 7:1](/josh#Josh.7.1)).

achbor_63.name: Achbor (A young prince at the court of Jehoiakim)
achbor_63.bio: The son of Micah, one of those whom Josiah sent to the prophetess Huldah to ascertain from her the meaning of the recently discovered book of the law ([2 Chr. 34:20](/2chr#2Chr.34.20)). He is called Achbor in [2 Kings 22:12](/2kgs#2Kgs.22.12).

achish_66.name: Achish
achish_66.bio: The king with whom David sought refuge when he fled from Saul ([1 Sam. 21:10-15](/1sam#1Sam.21.10)). He is called Abimelech in the superscription of [Ps.

achsah_68.name: Achsah
achsah_68.bio: Anklet, Caleb’s only daughter ([1 Chr. 2:49](/1chr#1Chr.2.49)). She was offered in marriage to the man who would lead an attack on the city of Debir, or Kirjath-sepher.

adah_69.name: Adah (first wife of either Lamech or of Esau)
adah_69.bio: The first of Lamech’s two wives, and the mother of Jabal and Jubal ([Gen. 4:19](/gen#Gen.4.19), [20](/gen#Gen.4.20), [23](/gen#Gen.4.23)).

adah_414.name: Adah (Wife of Esau)
adah_414.bio: The first of Esau’s three wives, the daughter of Elon the Hittite ([Gen. 36:2](/gen#Gen.36.2), [4](/gen#Gen.36.4)), called also Bashemath (26:34).

adaiah_71.name: Adaiah (. People with this name have a deep inne)

adam_78.name: Adam
adam_78.bio: Red, a Babylonian word, the generic name for man, having the same meaning in the Hebrew and the Assyrian languages. It was the name given to the first man, whose creation, fall, and subsequent history and that of his descendants are detailed in the first book of Moses ([Gen. 1:27](/gen#Gen.1.27)-ch.

adbeel_79.name: Adbeel
adbeel_79.bio: Miracle of God, the third of the twelve sons of Ishmael, and head of an Arabian tribe ([Gen. 25:13](/gen#Gen.25.13); [1 Chr. 1:29](/1chr#1Chr.1.29)).

addar_80.name: Addar
addar_80.bio: Ample, splendid, son of Bela ([1 Chr. 8:3](/1chr#1Chr.8.3)); called also “Ard” ([Gen. 46:21](/gen#Gen.46.21))

addi_81.name: Addi
addi_81.bio: Ornament, ([Luke 3:28](/luke#Luke.3.28)), the son of Cosam, and father of Melchi, one of the progenitors of Christ.

adiel_83.name: Adiel (also Elioenai)
adiel_83.bio: A family head of the tribe of Simeon ([1 Chr. 4:36](/1chr#1Chr.4.36)).

adina_88.name: Adina
adina_88.bio: Slender, one of David’s warriors ([1 Chr. 11:42](/1chr#1Chr.11.42)), a Reubenite.

adino_89.name: Adino
adino_89.bio: The Eznite, one of David’s mighty men ([2 Sam. 23:8](/2sam#2Sam.23.8)).

adnah_94.name: Adnah (Man of Manasseh who defected)
adnah_94.bio: A chief of the tribe of Manasseh who joined David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:20](/1chr#1Chr.12.20)).

adnah_95.name: Adnah (the commander)
adnah_95.bio: A general under Jehoshaphat, chief over 300,000 men ([2 Chr. 17:14](/2chr#2Chr.17.14)).

adonijah_97.name: Adonijah (fourth son of David in Hebron)
adonijah_97.bio: The fourth son of David ([2 Sam. 3:4](/2sam#2Sam.3.4)). After the death of his elder brothers, Amnon and Absalom, he became heir-apparent to the throne.

adonijah_98.name: Adonijah (Aspired to the throne)
adonijah_98.bio: A Levite sent with the princes to teach the book of the law to the inhabitants of Judah ([2 Chr. 17:8](/2chr#2Chr.17.8)).

adonijah_99.name: Adonijah (The fourth son of David)
adonijah_99.bio: One of the “chiefs of the people” after the Captivity ([Neh. 10:16](/neh#Neh.10.16)).

adonikam_100.name: Adonikam
adonikam_100.bio: Whom the Lord sets up, one of those “which came with Zerubbabel” ([Ezra 2:13](/ezra#Ezra.2.13)). His “children,” or retainers, to the number of 666, came up to Jerusalem (8:13).

adoniram_102.name: Adoniram
adoniram_102.bio: One who was “over the tribute;” i.e., “over the levy.” He was stoned by the Israelites after they had revolted from Rehoboam ([2 Chr. 10:18](/2chr#2Chr.10.18)). Called also Adoram ([2 Sam.

adrammelech_103.name: Adrammelech (the god of Sepharvaim)
adrammelech_103.bio: An idol; a form of the sun-god worshipped by the inhabitants of Sepharvaim ([2 Kings 17:31](/2kgs#2Kgs.17.31)), and brought by the Sepharvite colonists into Samaria.

adrammelech_104.name: Adrammelech (Son of the Assyrian king Sennacherib)
adrammelech_104.bio: A son of Sennacherib, king of Assyria ([2 Kings 19:37](/2kgs#2Kgs.19.37); [Isa. 37:38](/isa#Isa.37.38)).

adriel_105.name: Adriel
adriel_105.bio: Flock of God, the son of Barzillai, the Meholathite, to whom Saul gave in marriage his daughter Merab ([1 Sam. 18:19](/1sam#1Sam.18.19)). The five sons that sprang from this union were put to death by the Gibeonites ([2 Sam.

agabus_107.name: Agabus
agabus_107.bio: a "prophet," probably one of the seventy disciples of Christ. He prophesied at Antioch of an approaching famine ( Acts 11:27 Acts 11:28 ). Many years afterwards he met Paul at Caesarea, and warned him of the bonds and affliction that awaited him at Jerusalem should he persist in going thither ( Acts 21:10-12 ).

agag_108.name: Agag ((A later king)
agag_108.bio: A king of the Amalekites referred to by Balaam ([Num. 24:7](/num#Num.24.7)). He lived at the time of the Exodus.

agag_109.name: Agag (king of Amalek)
agag_109.bio: Another king of the Amalekites whom Saul spared unlawfully, but whom Samuel on his arrival in the camp of Saul ordered, in retributive justice ([Judg. 1](/judg#Judg.1)), to be brought out and cut in pieces ([1 Sam. 15:8-33](/1sam#1Sam.15.8).

agee_110.name: Agee
agee_110.bio: Fugitive, the father of Shammah, who was one of David’s mighty men ([2 Sam. 23:11](/2sam#2Sam.23.11))

agrippa_111.name: Agrippa
agrippa_111.bio: son of the foregoing, was born at Rome, A.D. 27. He was the brother of Bernice and Drusilla.

agur_112.name: Agur
agur_112.bio: Gatherer; the collector, mentioned as author of the sayings in [Prov. 30](/prov#Prov.30). Nothing is known of him beyond what is there recorded.

ahab_113.name: Ahab (Son of Omri)
ahab_113.bio: The son of Omri, whom he succeeded as the seventh king of Israel. His history is recorded in [1 Kings 16](/1kgs#1Kgs.16)-22. His wife was Jezebel (q.v.), who exercised a very evil influence over him.

ahab_114.name: Ahab (son of Kolaiah)
ahab_114.bio: A false prophet referred to by Jeremiah ([Jer. 29:21](/jer#Jer.29.21)), of whom nothing further is known.

ahasuerus_117.name: Ahasuerus
ahasuerus_117.bio: The son of Darius Hystaspes, the king named in the Book of Esther. He ruled over the kingdoms of Persia, Media, and Babylonia, “from India to Ethiopia.” This was in all probability the Xerxes of profane history, who succeeded his father Darius (B.C. 485).

ahaz_118.name: Ahaz (Hebrew: יְהוֹאָחָז)
ahaz_118.bio: The son and successor of Jotham, king of Judah ([2 Kings 16](/2kgs#2Kgs.16); [Isa. 7](/isa#Isa.7)-9; [2 Chr. 28](/2chr#2Chr.28)).

ahaziah_120.name: Ahaziah (Son of Ahab and King of Israel in Samari)
ahaziah_120.bio: The son and successor of Ahab. He followed the counsels of his mother Jezebel, and imitated in wickedness the ways of his father. In his reign the Moabites revolted from under his authority ([2 Kings 3:5-7](/2kgs#2Kgs.3.5)).

ahaziah_121.name: Ahaziah (king of Judah)
ahaziah_121.bio: The son of Joram, or Jehoram, and sixth king of Judah. Called Jehoahaz ([2 Chr. 21:17](/2chr#2Chr.21.17); [25:23](/2chr#2Chr.25.23)), and Azariah ([2 Chr.

ahiah_128.name: Ahiah (high priest in the reign of Saul)
ahiah_128.bio: One of the sons of Bela ([1 Chr. 8:7](/1chr#1Chr.8.7), R.V.). In A.V.

ahiam_129.name: Ahiam
ahiam_129.bio: Mother’s brother, one of David’s thirty heroes ([2 Sam. 23:33](/2sam#2Sam.23.33); [1 Chr. 11:35](/1chr#1Chr.11.35)).

ahiezer_131.name: Ahiezer (Captain of the tribe of Dan)

ahiezer_132.name: Ahiezer (People with this name tend to be passion)
ahiezer_132.bio: The chief of the Benjamite slingers that repaired to David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:3](/1chr#1Chr.12.3)).

ahihud_133.name: Ahihud (son of Shelomi)
ahihud_133.bio: Name different in Hebrew, meaning brother of Judah. Chief of the tribe of Asher; one of those appointed by Moses to superintend the division of Canaan among the tribe ([Num. 34:27](/num#Num.34.27)).

ahihud_134.name: Ahihud (son of Ehud)
ahihud_134.bio: A son of Bela, the son of Benjamin ([1 Chr. 8:7](/1chr#1Chr.8.7)).

ahijah_135.name: Ahijah (the prophet of Shiloh)
ahijah_135.bio: A prophet of Shiloh ([1 Kings 11:29](/1kgs#1Kgs.11.29); [14:2](/1kgs#1Kgs.14.2)), called the “Shilonite,” in the days of Rehoboam. We have on record two of his remarkable prophecies, [1 Kings 11:31-39](/1kgs#1Kgs.11.31), announcing the rending of the ten tribes from Solomon; and [1 Kings 14:6-16](/1kgs#1Kgs.14.6), delivered to Jeroboam’s wife, foretelling the death of Abijah the king’s son, the destruction of Jeroboam’s house, and the captivity of Israel “beyond the river.” Jeroboam bears testimony to the high esteem in which he was held as a prophet of God ([1 Kings 14:2](/1kgs#1Kgs.14.2), [3](/1kgs#1Kgs.14.3)).

ahijah_137.name: Ahijah ([ Jerahmeel Son of Hezron ] The sons of)
ahijah_137.bio: One of the five sons of Jerahmeel, who was great-grandson of Judah ([1 Chr. 2:25](/1chr#1Chr.2.25)).

ahijah_138.name: Ahijah (Brother of the Lord)
ahijah_138.bio: A Pelonite, one of David’s heroes ([1 Chr. 11:36](/1chr#1Chr.11.36)); called also Eliam ([2 Sam. 23:34](/2sam#2Sam.23.34)).

ahijah_139.name: Ahijah (Son of Jerahmeel)
ahijah_139.bio: A Levite having charge of the sacred treasury in the temple ([1 Chr. 26:20](/1chr#1Chr.26.20)).

ahikam_141.name: Ahikam
ahikam_141.bio: Brother of support = helper, one of the five whom Josiah sent to consult the prophetess Huldah in connection with the discovery of the book of the law ([2 Kings 22:12-14](/2kgs#2Kgs.22.12); [2 Chr. 34:20](/2chr#2Chr.34.20)). He was the son of Shaphan, the royal secretary, and the father of Gedaliah, governor of Judea after the destruction of Jerusalem by the Babylonians ([2 Kings 25:22](/2kgs#2Kgs.25.22); [Jer.

ahimaaz_143.name: Ahimaaz (Ahinoam daughter of Ahimaaz)
ahimaaz_143.bio: The father Ahinoam, the wife of Saul ([1 Sam. 14:50](/1sam#1Sam.14.50)).

ahimaaz_144.name: Ahimaaz (Jonathan)
ahimaaz_144.bio: The son and successor of Zadok in the office of high priest ([1 Chr. 6:8](/1chr#1Chr.6.8), [53](/1chr#1Chr.6.53)). On the occasion of the revolt of Absalom he remained faithful to David, and was of service to him in conveying to him tidings of the proceedings of Absalom in Jerusalem ([2 Sam.

ahiman_146.name: Ahiman (A Levite)
ahiman_146.bio: One of the three giant Anakim brothers whom Caleb and the spies saw in Mount Hebron ([Num. 13:22](/num#Num.13.22)) when they went in to explore the land. They were afterwards driven out and slain ([Josh.

ahiman_147.name: Ahiman (A guardian of the temple)
ahiman_147.bio: One of the guardians of the temple after the Exile ([1 Chr. 9:17](/1chr#1Chr.9.17)).

ahimelech_126.name: Ahimelech (The son of Ahitub and father of Abiathar)
ahimelech_126.bio: Son of Ahitub ([1 Sam. 14:3](/1sam#1Sam.14.3), [18](/1sam#1Sam.14.18)), Ichabod’s brother; the same probably as Ahimelech, who was high priest at Nob in the reign of Saul ([1 Sam. 22:11](/1sam#1Sam.22.11)).

ahimelech_149.name: Ahimelech (Father of Abiathar the priest)
ahimelech_149.bio: The son of Abiathar, and high priest in the time of David ([1 Chr. 18:16](/1chr#1Chr.18.16)). In the parallel passage, [2 Sam.

ahinadab_151.name: Ahinadab
ahinadab_151.bio: Brother of liberality = liberal, one of the twelve commissariat officers appointed by Solomon in so many districts of his kingdom to raise supplies by monthly rotation for his household. He was appointed to the district of Mahanaim ([1 Kings 4:14](/1kgs#1Kgs.4.14)), east of Jordan.

ahinoam_152.name: Ahinoam (wife of Saul)
ahinoam_152.bio: The daughter of Ahimaaz, and wife of Saul ([1 Sam. 14:50](/1sam#1Sam.14.50)).

ahinoam_153.name: Ahinoam (said to come from Jezreel)
ahinoam_153.bio: A Jezreelitess, the first wife of David ([1 Sam. 25:43](/1sam#1Sam.25.43); [27:3](/1sam#1Sam.27.3)). She was the mother of Amnon ([2 Sam.

ahio_154.name: Ahio (sons of Abinadab)
ahio_154.bio: One of the sons of Abinadab the Levite. While Uzzah went by the side of the ark, he walked before it guiding the oxen which drew the cart on which it was carried, after having brought it from his father’s house in Gibeah ([1 Chr. 13:7](/1chr#1Chr.13.7); [2 Sam.

ahio_155.name: Ahio (Shashak)
ahio_155.bio: One of the sons of Beriah ([1 Chr. 8:14](/1chr#1Chr.8.14)).

ahio_156.name: Ahio (One of the sons of Abinadab the Levite.)
ahio_156.bio: One of the sons of Jehiel the Gibeonite ([1 Chr. 8:31](/1chr#1Chr.8.31); [9:37](/1chr#1Chr.9.37)).

ahira_157.name: Ahira
ahira_157.bio: Brother of evil = unlucky, or my brother is friend, chief of the tribe of Naphtali at the Exodus ([Num. 1:15](/num#Num.1.15); [2:29](/num#Num.2.29)).

ahishar_161.name: Ahishar
ahishar_161.bio: Brother of song = singer, the officer who was “over the household” of Solomon ([1 Kings 4:6](/1kgs#1Kgs.4.6)).

ahithophel_162.name: Ahithophel
ahithophel_162.bio: Brother of insipidity or impiety, a man greatly renowned for his sagacity among the Jews. At the time of Absalom’s revolt he deserted David ([Ps. 41:9](/ps#Ps.41.9); [55:12-14](/ps#Ps.55.12)) and espoused the cause of Absalom ([2 Sam.

ahitub_163.name: Ahitub (The son of Phinehas)
ahitub_163.bio: The son of Phinehas. On the death of his grandfather Eli he succeeded to the office of high priest, and was himself succeeded by his son Ahijah ([1 Sam. 14:3](/1sam#1Sam.14.3); [22:9](/1sam#1Sam.22.9), [11](/1sam#1Sam.22.11), [12](/1sam#1Sam.22.12), [20](/1sam#1Sam.22.20)).

ahitub_164.name: Ahitub (Grandson of High Priest Eli)
ahitub_164.bio: The father of Zadok, who was made high priest by Saul after the extermination of the family of Ahimelech ([1 Chr. 6:7](/1chr#1Chr.6.7), [8](/1chr#1Chr.6.8); [2 Sam. 8:17](/2sam#2Sam.8.17)).

ahoah_168.name: Ahoah
ahoah_168.bio: Brotherly, one of the sons of Bela, the son of Benjamin ([1 Chr. 8:4](/1chr#1Chr.8.4)). He is also called Ahiah (ver.

aholiab_170.name: Aholiab
aholiab_170.bio: Tent of the father, an artist of the tribe of Dan, appointed to the work of preparing materials for the tabernacle ([Ex. 31:6](/exod#Exod.31.6); [35:34](/exod#Exod.35.34); [36:1](/exod#Exod.36.1), [2](/exod#Exod.36.2); [38:23](/exod#Exod.38.23)).

aholibah_171.name: Aholibah
aholibah_171.bio: My tent is in her, the name of an imaginary harlot, applied symbolically to Jerusalem, because she had abandoned the worship of the true God and given herself up to the idolatries of foreign nations. ([Ezek. 23:4](/ezek#Ezek.23.4), [11](/ezek#Ezek.23.11), [22](/ezek#Ezek.23.22), [36](/ezek#Ezek.23.36), [44](/ezek#Ezek.23.44)).

aholibamah_1761.name: Aholibamah (Wife of Esau)
aholibamah_1761.bio: Jewess, the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and one of Esau’s wives ([Gen. 26:34](/gen#Gen.26.34)), elsewhere called Aholibamah (36:2-14).

akan_179.name: Akan
akan_179.bio: He twists, one of the sons of Ezer, the son of Seir the Horite ([1 Chr. 1:42](/1chr#1Chr.1.42)).

akkub_181.name: Akkub (gatekeepers who guarded the storerooms a)
akkub_181.bio: A Levite who kept the gate of the temple after the return from Babylon ([1 Chr. 9:17](/1chr#1Chr.9.17); [Ezra 2:42](/ezra#Ezra.2.42); [Neh. 7:45](/neh#Neh.7.45)).

akkub_182.name: Akkub (Name of a family of temple servants)
akkub_182.bio: The head of one of the families of Nethinim ([Ezra 2:45](/ezra#Ezra.2.45)).

alameth_184.name: Alameth
alameth_184.bio: One of the nine sons of Becher, the son of Benjamin ([1 Chr. 7:8](/1chr#1Chr.7.8)).

alemeth_185.name: Alemeth
alemeth_185.bio: One of the sons of Jehoadah, or Jarah, son of Ahaz ([1 Chr. 8:36](/1chr#1Chr.8.36)).

alexander_186.name: Alexander (son of Simon of Cyrene)
alexander_186.bio: A man whose father, Simon the Cyrenian, bore the cross of Christ ([Mark 15:21](/mark#Mark.15.21)).

alexander_187.name: Alexander (a member of the family of Annas the high)
alexander_187.bio: man-defender. A man whose father, Simon the Cyrenian, bore the cross of Christ ( Mark 15:21 ).

alexander_188.name: Alexander (The Jews in the crowd pushed Alexander t)
alexander_188.bio: man-defender. A Jew of Ephesus who took a prominent part in the uproar raised there by the preaching of Paul ( Acts 19:33 ). The Jews put him forward to plead their cause before the mob.

alexander_189.name: Alexander (Hymenaeus)
alexander_189.bio: A coppersmith who, with Hymenaeus and others, promulgated certain heresies regarding the resurrection ([1 Tim. 1:19](/1tim#1Tim.1.19); [2 Tim. 4:14](/2tim#2Tim.4.14)), and made shipwreck of faith and of a good conscience.

allon_190.name: Allon
allon_190.bio: The son of Jedaiah, of the family of the Simeonites, who expelled the Hamites from the valley of Gedor ([1 Chr. 4:37](/1chr#1Chr.4.37)).

almodad_191.name: Almodad
almodad_191.bio: Immeasurable, the first named of the sons of Joktan ([Gen. 10:26](/gen#Gen.10.26)), the founder of an Arabian tribe.

alphaeus_192.name: Alphaeus (Father of Levi)
alphaeus_192.bio: The father of James the Less, the apostle and writer of the epistle ( Matthew 10:3 ; Mark 3:18 ; Luke 6:15 ; Acts 1:13 ), and the husband of Mary ( John 19:25 ). The Hebrew form of this name is Cleopas, or Clopas (q.v.).

alphaeus_193.name: Alphaeus (Father of Levi)
alphaeus_193.bio: The father of Levi, or Matthew ([Mark 2:14](/mark#Mark.2.14)).

amalek_197.name: Amalek
amalek_197.bio: Dweller in a valley, the son of Eliphaz and grandson of Esau ([Gen. 36:12](/gen#Gen.36.12); [1 Chr. 1:36](/1chr#1Chr.1.36)); the chief of an Idumean tribe ([Gen.

amariah_198.name: Amariah (father of Ahitub)
amariah_198.bio: One of the descendants of Aaron by Eleazar ([1 Chr. 6:7](/1chr#1Chr.6.7), [52](/1chr#1Chr.6.52)). He was probably the last of the high priests of Eleazar’s line prior to the transfer of that office to Eli, of the line of Ithamar.

amariah_200.name: Amariah (sons of Hebron)
amariah_200.bio: A Levite, son of Hebron, of the lineage of Moses ([1 Chr. 23:19](/1chr#1Chr.23.19); [24:23](/1chr#1Chr.24.23)).

amariah_201.name: Amariah (son of Ishmael)
amariah_201.bio: A “chief priest” who took an active part in the reformation under Jehoshaphat ([2 Chr. 19:11](/2chr#2Chr.19.11)); probably the same as mentioned in [1 Chr. 6:9](/1chr#1Chr.6.9).

amariah_202.name: Amariah (A man of Judah)
amariah_202.bio: One of the high priests in the time of Hezekiah ([2 Chr. 31:15](/2chr#2Chr.31.15)).

amasa_207.name: Amasa (Commander of the army of Absalom)
amasa_207.bio: The son of Abigail, a sister of king David ([1 Chr. 2:17](/1chr#1Chr.2.17); [2 Sam. 17:25](/2sam#2Sam.17.25)).

amasa_208.name: Amasa (son of Hadlai)
amasa_208.bio: A son of Hadlai, and chief of Ephraim ([2 Chr. 28:12](/2chr#2Chr.28.12)) in the reign of Ahaz.

amasai_209.name: Amasai (1 Chronicles 6:25)
amasai_209.bio: A Levite, son of Elkanah, of the ancestry of Samuel ([1 Chr. 6:25](/1chr#1Chr.6.25), [35](/1chr#1Chr.6.35)).

amasai_210.name: Amasai (A descendant of Kohath)
amasai_210.bio: The leader of a body of men who joined David in the “stronghold,” probably of Adullam ([1 Chr. 12:18](/1chr#1Chr.12.18)).

amasai_211.name: Amasai (Played the trumpet)
amasai_211.bio: One of the priests appointed to precede the ark with blowing of trumpets on its removal from the house of Obed-edom ([1 Chr. 15:24](/1chr#1Chr.15.24)).

amasai_212.name: Amasai (burdensome)
amasai_212.bio: The father of a Levite, one of the two Kohathites who took a prominent part at the instance of Hezekiah in the cleansing of the temple ([2 Chr. 29:12](/2chr#2Chr.29.12)).

amasiah_213.name: Amasiah
amasiah_213.bio: Burden of (i.e., “sustained by”) Jehovah, the “son of Zichri, who willingly offered himself unto the Lord,” a captain over thousands under Jehoshaphat ([2 Chr. 17:16](/2chr#2Chr.17.16); comp. [Judg.

amaziah_214.name: Amaziah (king of Judah)
amaziah_214.bio: The son and successor of Joash, and eighth king of the separate kingdom of Judah ([2 Kings 14:1-4](/2kgs#2Kgs.14.1)). He began his reign by punishing the murderers of his father (5-7; [2 Chr. 25:3-5](/2chr#2Chr.25.3)).

amaziah_215.name: Amaziah (King of Judah)
amaziah_215.bio: The father of Joshah, one of the Simeonite chiefs in the time of Hezekiah ([1 Chr. 4:34](/1chr#1Chr.4.34)).

amaziah_216.name: Amaziah (father of Hashabiah)
amaziah_216.bio: A Levite, son of Hilkiah, of the descendants of Ethan the Merarite ([1 Chr. 6:45](/1chr#1Chr.6.45)).

amaziah_217.name: Amaziah (Jeroboam)
amaziah_217.bio: A priest of the golden calves at Bethel ([Amos 7:10-17](/amos#Amos.7.10)).

amittai_219.name: Amittai
amittai_219.bio: True, the father of Jonah the prophet, a native of Gath-hepher ([2 Kings 14:25](/2kgs#2Kgs.14.25); [Jonah 1:1](/jonah#Jonah.1.1)).

ammiel_220.name: Ammiel (son of Gemalli)
ammiel_220.bio: One of the twelve spies sent by Moses to search the land of Canaan ([Num. 13:12](/num#Num.13.12)). He was one of the ten who perished by the plague for their unfavourable report ([Num.

ammiel_221.name: Ammiel (son of Gemalli)
ammiel_221.bio: The father of Machir of Lo-debar, in whose house Mephibosheth resided ([2 Sam. 9:4](/2sam#2Sam.9.4), [5](/2sam#2Sam.9.5); 17:27).

ammiel_222.name: Ammiel (sixth)
ammiel_222.bio: One of the sons of Obed-edom the Levite ([1 Chr. 26:5](/1chr#1Chr.26.5)).

ammihud_223.name: Ammihud (father of general Elishama)
ammihud_223.bio: The father of the Ephraimite chief Elishama, at the time of the Exodus ([Num. 1:10](/num#Num.1.10); [2:18](/num#Num.2.18); [7:48](/num#Num.7.48), [53](/num#Num.7.53)).

ammihud_226.name: Ammihud (son of Ammihud)
ammihud_226.bio: The father of Talmai, king of Geshur, to whom Absalom fled after the murder of Amnon ([2 Sam. 13:37](/2sam#2Sam.13.37)).

ammihud_227.name: Ammihud (son of Omri)
ammihud_227.bio: The son of Omri, and the father of Uthai ([1 Chr. 9:4](/1chr#1Chr.9.4)).

amminadab_228.name: Amminadab (Father-in-law of Aaron)
amminadab_228.bio: The father of Nahshon, who was chief of the tribe of Judah ([Num. 1:7](/num#Num.1.7); [2:3](/num#Num.2.3); [7:12](/num#Num.7.12), [17](/num#Num.7.17); [10:14](/num#Num.10.14)). His daughter Elisheba was married to Aaron ([Ex.

amminadab_229.name: Amminadab (The father of Nahshon)
amminadab_229.bio: Chief of the 112 descendants of Uzziel the Levite ([1 Chr. 15:10](/1chr#1Chr.15.10), [11](/1chr#1Chr.15.11)).

ammishaddai_230.name: Ammishaddai
ammishaddai_230.bio: People of the Almighty, the father of Ahiezer, who was chief of the Danites at the time of the Exodus ([Num. 1:12](/num#Num.1.12); [2:25](/num#Num.2.25)). This is one of the few names compounded with the name of God, Shaddai, “Almighty.”

ammizabad_231.name: Ammizabad
ammizabad_231.bio: People of the giver, the son of Benaiah, who was the third and chief captain of the host under David ([1 Chr. 27:6](/1chr#1Chr.27.6)).

amnon_232.name: Amnon (son of Ahinoam)
amnon_232.bio: The eldest son of David, by Ahinoam of Jezreel ([1 Chr. 3:1](/1chr#1Chr.3.1); [2 Sam. 3:2](/2sam#2Sam.3.2)).

amnon_233.name: Amnon (Son of Shimon)
amnon_233.bio: One of the sons of Shammai, of the children of Ezra ([1 Chr. 4:20](/1chr#1Chr.4.20); comp. 17).

amon_235.name: Amon (eight ancient egyptian gods)
amon_235.bio: The governor of Samaria in the time of Ahab. The prophet Micaiah was committed to his custody ([1 Kings 22:26](/1kgs#1Kgs.22.26); [2 Chr. 18:25](/2chr#2Chr.18.25)).

amon_236.name: Amon (King of Judah)
amon_236.bio: The son of Manasseh, and fourteenth king of Judah. He restored idolatry, and set up the images which his father had cast down. Zephaniah (1:4; 3:4, 11) refers to the moral depravity prevailing in this king’s reign.

amorite_237.name: Amorite
amorite_237.bio: Highlanders, or hillmen, the name given to the descendants of one of the sons of Canaan ([Gen. 14:7](/gen#Gen.14.7)), called Amurra or Amurri in the Assyrian and Egyptian inscriptions. On the early Babylonian monuments all Syria, including Palestine, is known as “the land of the Amorites.” The southern slopes of the mountains of Judea are called the “mount of the Amorites” ([Deut.

amos_238.name: Amos (one of the Twelve Minor Prophets)
amos_238.bio: Borne; a burden, one of the twelve minor prophets. He was a native of Tekota, the modern Tekua, a town about 12 miles south-east of Bethlehem. He was a man of humble birth, neither a “prophet nor a prophet’s son,” but “an herdman and a dresser of sycomore trees,” R.V.

amoz_240.name: Amoz
amoz_240.bio: Strong, the father of the prophet Isaiah ([2 Kings 19:2](/2kgs#2Kgs.19.2), [20](/2kgs#2Kgs.19.20); 20:1; [Isa. 1:1](/isa#Isa.1.1); [2:1](/isa#Isa.2.1)). As to his personal history little is positively known.

amplias_241.name: Amplias
amplias_241.bio: A Roman Christian saluted by Paul ([Rom. 16:8](/rom#Rom.16.8)).

amram_242.name: Amram (son of Kohath)
amram_242.bio: The son of Kohath, the son of Levi. He married Jochebed, “his father’s sister,” and was the father of Aaron, Miriam, and Moses ([Ex. 6:18](/exod#Exod.6.18), [20](/exod#Exod.6.20); [Num.

amraphel_244.name: Amraphel
amraphel_244.bio: King of Shinar, southern Chaldea, one of the confederates of Chedorlaomer, king of Elam, in a war against Sodom and cities of the plain ([Gen. 14:1](/gen#Gen.14.1), [4](/gen#Gen.14.4)). It is now found that Amraphel (or Ammirapaltu) is the Khammu-rabi whose name appears on recently-discovered monuments.

amzi_245.name: Amzi (Placed on the left hand side of his bret)

anaiah_251.name: Anaiah (one of the leaders of the people who sea)

anak_252.name: Anak
anak_252.bio: Long-necked, the son of Arba, father of the Anakim ([Josh. 15:13](/josh#Josh.15.13); [21:11](/josh#Josh.21.11), Heb. Anok).

anamim_253.name: Anamim
anamim_253.bio: The name of an Egyptian tribe descended from Mizraim ([Gen. 10:13](/gen#Gen.10.13); [1 Chr. 1:11](/1chr#1Chr.1.11)).

anammelech_254.name: Anammelech
anammelech_254.bio: One of the gods worshipped by the people of Sepharvaim, who colonized Samaria ([2 Kings 17:31](/2kgs#2Kgs.17.31)). The name means “Anu is king.” It was a female deity representing the moon, as Adrammelech (q.v.) was the male representing the sun.

anan_255.name: Anan
anan_255.bio: Cloud, one of the Israelites who sealed the covenant after the return from Babylon ([Neh. 10:26](/neh#Neh.10.26)).

ananias_258.name: Ananias (Husband of Sapphira)
ananias_258.bio: a common Jewish name, the same as Hananiah. One of the members of the church at Jerusalem, who conspired with his wife Sapphira to deceive the brethren, and who fell down and immediately expired after he had uttered the falsehood ( Acts 5:5 ). By common agreement the members of the early Christian community devoted their property to the work of furthering the gospel and of assisting the poor and needy.

ananias_259.name: Ananias (favoured of the LORD)
ananias_259.bio: A Christian at Damascus ( Acts 9:10 ). He became Paul's instructor; but when or by what means he himself became a Christian we have no information. He was "a devout man according to the law, having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt" at Damascus ( 22:12 ).

ananias_260.name: Ananias (High priest)
ananias_260.bio: The high priest before whom Paul was brought in the procuratorship of Felix ( Acts 23:2 Acts 23:5 Acts 23:24 ). He was so enraged at Paul's noble declaration, "I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day," that he commanded one of his attendants to smite him on the mouth. Smarting under this unprovoked insult, Paul quickly replied, "God shall smite thee, thou whited wall." Being reminded that Ananias was the high priest, to whose office all respect was to be paid, he answered, "I wist not, brethren, that he was the high priest" ( Acts 23:5 ).

anath_261.name: Anath
anath_261.bio: An answer; i.e., to “prayer”, the father of Shamgar, who was one of the judges of Israel ([Judg. 3:31](/judg#Judg.3.31)).

andrew_264.name: Andrew
andrew_264.bio: manliness, a Greek name; one of the apostles of our Lord. He was of Bethsaida in Galilee ( John 1:44 ), and was the brother of Simon Peter ( Matthew 4:18 ; 10:2 ). On one occasion John the Baptist, whose disciple he then was, pointing to Jesus, said, "Behold the Lamb of God" ( John 1:40 ); and Andrew, hearing him, immediately became a follower of Jesus, the first of his disciples.

andronicus_265.name: Andronicus
andronicus_265.bio: Man-conquering, a Jewish Christian, the kinsman and fellowprisoner of Paul ([Rom. 16:7](/rom#Rom.16.7)); “of note among the apostles.”

aner_266.name: Aner
aner_266.bio: A Canaanitish chief who joined his forces with those of Abraham in pursuit of Chedorlaomer ([Gen. 14:13](/gen#Gen.14.13), [24](/gen#Gen.14.24)).

anna_268.name: Anna
anna_268.bio: Grace, an aged widow, the daughter of Phanuel. She was a “prophetess,” like Miriam, Deborah, and Huldah ([2 Chr. 34:22](/2chr#2Chr.34.22)).

annas_269.name: Annas
annas_269.bio: was high priest A.D. 7-14. In A.D.

antipas_270.name: Antipas
antipas_270.bio: A “faithful martyr” ([Rev. 2:13](/rev#Rev.2.13)), of whom nothing more is certainly known.

apelles_273.name: Apelles
apelles_273.bio: A Christian at Rome whom Paul salutes ([Rom. 16:10](/rom#Rom.16.10)), and styles “approved in Christ.”

apollos_276.name: Apollos
apollos_276.bio: a Jew "born at Alexandria," a man well versed in the Scriptures and eloquent ( Acts 18:24 ; RSV, "learned"). He came to Ephesus (about A.D. 49), where he spake "boldly" in the synagogue ( 18:26 ), although he did not know as yet that Jesus of Nazareth was the Messiah.

apollyon_2.name: Apollyon
apollyon_2.bio: Destruction, the Hebrew name (equivalent to the Greek Apollyon, i.e., destroyer) of “the angel of the bottomless pit” ([Rev. 9:11](/rev#Rev.9.11)). It is rendered “destruction” in [Job 28:22](/job#Job.28.22); [31:12](/job#Job.31.12); [26:6](/job#Job.26.6); [Prov.

apphia_278.name: Apphia
apphia_278.bio: Increasing, a female Christian at Colosse ([Philemon 1](/phlm#Phlm.1.1):2), supposed by some to have been the wife of Philemon.

aquila_279.name: Aquila
aquila_279.bio: eagle, a native of Pontus, by occupation a tent-maker, whom Paul met on his first visit to Corinth ( Acts 18:2 ). Along with his wife Priscilla he had fled from Rome in consequence of a decree (A.D. 50) by Claudius commanding all Jews to leave the city.

arad_281.name: Arad
arad_281.bio: One of the sons of Beriah ([1 Chr. 8:15](/1chr#1Chr.8.15)).

aram_285.name: Aram (Ancestor of Aramean)
aram_285.bio: The son of Shem ([Gen. 10:22](/gen#Gen.10.22)); according to [Gen. 22:21](/gen#Gen.22.21), a grandson of Nahor.

aram_286.name: Aram (son of Kemuel)
aram_286.bio: The son of Shem ([Gen. 10:22](/gen#Gen.10.22)); according to [Gen. 22:21](/gen#Gen.22.21), a grandson of Nahor.

aran_288.name: Aran
aran_288.bio: Wild goat, a descendant of Seir the Horite ([Gen. 36:28](/gen#Gen.36.28)).

archelaus_291.name: Archelaus
archelaus_291.bio: Ruler of the people, son of Herod the Great, by Malthace, a Samaritan woman. He was educated along with his brother Antipas at Rome. He inherited from his father a third part of his kingdom viz., Idumea, Judea, and Samaria, and hence is called “king” ([Matt.

archippus_292.name: Archippus
archippus_292.bio: Master of the horse, a “fellow-soldier” of Paul’s ([Philemon 1](/phlm#Phlm.1.1):2), whom he exhorts to renewed activity ([Col. 4:17](/col#Col.4.17)). He was a member of Philemon’s family, probably his son.

ard_294.name: Ard (Naamite clan)
ard_294.bio: Descent, a grandson of Benjamin ([Num. 26:38-40](/num#Num.26.38)). In [1 Chr.

ardon_295.name: Ardon
ardon_295.bio: Descendant, the last of the three sons of Caleb by his first wife Azubah ([1 Chr. 2:18](/1chr#1Chr.2.18)).

aretas_297.name: Aretas
aretas_297.bio: The father-in-law of Herod Antipas, and king of Arabia Petraea. His daughter returned to him on the occasion of her husband’s entering into an adulterous alliance with Herodias, the wife of Herod-Philip, his half-brother ([Luke 3:19](/luke#Luke.3.19), [20](/luke#Luke.3.20); [Mark 6:17](/mark#Mark.6.17); [Matt. 14:3](/matt#Matt.14.3)).

arieh_301.name: Arieh
arieh_301.bio: The lion, the name of one of the body-guard slain with Pekahiah at Samaria ([2 Kings 15:25](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.25)) by the conspirator Pekah.

ariel_302.name: Ariel
ariel_302.bio: One of the chief men sent by Ezra to procure Levites for the sanctuary ([Ezra 8:16](/ezra#Ezra.8.16)).

arioch_303.name: Arioch (king of Ellasar)
arioch_303.bio: A king of Ellasar who was confederate with Chedorlamer ([Gen. 14:1](/gen#Gen.14.1), [9](/gen#Gen.14.9)). The tablets recently discovered by Mr.

aristarchus_306.name: Aristarchus
aristarchus_306.bio: best ruler, native of Thessalonica ( Acts 20:4 ), a companion of Paul ( Acts 19:29 ; 27:2 ). He was Paul's "fellow-prisoner" at Rome ( Colossians 4:10 ; Philemon 1:24 ).

arkite_308.name: Arkite
arkite_308.bio: ([Gen. 10:17](/gen#Gen.10.17); [1 Chr. 1:15](/1chr#1Chr.1.15)), a designation of certain descendants from the Phoenicians or Sidonians, the inhabitants of Arka, 12 miles north of Tripoli, opposite the northern extremity of Lebanon.

armoni_309.name: Armoni
armoni_309.bio: Inhabitant of a fortress, the first-named of the two sons of Saul and Rizpah. He was delivered up to the Gibeonites by David, and hanged by them ([2 Sam. 21:8](/2sam#2Sam.21.8), [9](/2sam#2Sam.21.9)).

arphaxad_312.name: Arphaxad
arphaxad_312.bio: Son of Shem, born the year after the Deluge. He died at the age of 438 years ([Gen. 11:10-13](/gen#Gen.11.10); [1 Chr.

artaxerxes_313.name: Artaxerxes (king of Persia)
artaxerxes_313.bio: The king who obstructed the rebuilding of the temple ([Ezra 4:7](/ezra#Ezra.4.7)). He was probably the Smerdis of profane history.

artaxerxes_314.name: Artaxerxes (King of Persia)
artaxerxes_314.bio: The king mentioned in [Ezra 7:1](/ezra#Ezra.7.1), in the seventh year (B.C. 458) of whose reign Ezra led a second colony of Jews back to Jerusalem, was probably Longimanus, who reigned for forty years (B.C. 464-425); the grandson of Darius, who, fourteen years later, permitted Nehemiah to return and rebuild Jerusalem.

asa_318.name: Asa (physician)
asa_318.bio: Physician, son of Abijah and grandson of Rehoboam, was the third king of Judah. He was zealous in maintaining the true worship of God, and in rooting all idolatry, with its accompanying immoralities, out of the land ([1 Kings 15:8-14](/1kgs#1Kgs.15.8)). The Lord gave him and his land rest and prosperity.

asa_319.name: Asa (who lived in the villages of the Netopha)

asahel_320.name: Asahel (fleet-footed as a wild gazelle)
asahel_320.bio: Made by God, the youngest son of Zeruiah, David’s sister. He was celebrated for his swiftness of foot. When fighting against Ish-bosheth at Gibeon, in the army of his brother Joab, he was put to death by Abner, whom he pursued from the field of battle ([2 Sam.

asahiah_324.name: Asahiah
asahiah_324.bio: The son of Amoz ([Isa. 1:1](/isa#Isa.1.1); [2:1](/isa#Isa.2.1)), who was apparently a man of humble rank. His wife was called “the prophetess” (8:3), either because she was endowed with the prophetic gift, like Deborah ([Judg.

asaph_329.name: Asaph (son of Hilkiahson)
asaph_329.bio: The “recorder” in the time of Hezekiah ([2 Kings 18:18](/2kgs#2Kgs.18.18), [37](/2kgs#2Kgs.18.37)).

asaph_330.name: Asaph (Levite)
asaph_330.bio: A Levite; one of the leaders of David’s choir ([1 Chr. 6:39](/1chr#1Chr.6.39)). [Psalms 50](/ps#Ps.50) and 73-83 inclusive are attributed to him.

asaph_332.name: Asaph (citadel)
asaph_332.bio: The “keeper of the king’s forest,” to whom Nehemiah requested from Artaxerxes a “letter” that he might give him timber for the temple at Jerusalem ([Neh. 2:8](/neh#Neh.2.8)).

asenath_335.name: Asenath
asenath_335.bio: An Egyptian name, meaning “gift of the sun-god”, daughter of Potipherah, priest of On or Heliopolis, wife of Joseph ([Gen. 41:45](/gen#Gen.41.45)). She was the mother of Manasseh and Ephraim (50-52; 46:20).

asher_337.name: Asher
asher_337.bio: Happy, Jacob’s eigth son; his mother was Zilpah, Leah’s handmaid ([Gen. 30:13](/gen#Gen.30.13)). Of the tribe founded by him nothing is recorded beyond its holding a place in the list of the tribes (35:26; 46:17; [Ex.

ashkenaz_338.name: Ashkenaz
ashkenaz_338.bio: One of the three sons of Gomer ([Gen. 10:3](/gen#Gen.10.3)), and founder of one of the tribes of the Japhetic race. They are mentioned in connection with Minni and Ararat, and hence their original seat must have been in Armenia ([Jer.

ashpenaz_339.name: Ashpenaz
ashpenaz_339.bio: The master of the eunuchs of Nebuchadnezzar ([Dan. 1:3](/dan#Dan.1.3)), the “Rabsaris” of the court. His position was similar to that of the Kislar-aga of the modern Turkish sultans.

ashtoreth_341.name: Ashtoreth
ashtoreth_341.bio: The moon goddess of the Phoenicians, representing the passive principle in nature, their principal female deity; frequently associated with the name of Baal, the sun-god, their chief male deity ([Judg. 10:6](/judg#Judg.10.6); [1 Sam. 7:4](/1sam#1Sam.7.4); [12:10](/1sam#1Sam.12.10)).

asnappar_346.name: Asnappar
asnappar_346.bio: Probably the same as Assur-bani-pal (Sardanapalos of the Greeks), styled the “great and noble” ([Ezra 4:10](/ezra#Ezra.4.10)), was the son and successor (B.C. 668) of Esar-haddon (q.v.). He was “luxurious, ambitious, and cruel, but a magnificent patron of literature.” He formed at Nineveh a library of clay tablets, numbering about 10,000.

assir_352.name: Assir (The descendants of Kohath: Ebiasaph his)

athaliah_359.name: Athaliah (wife of Jehoram)
athaliah_359.bio: The daughter of Ahab and Jezebel, and the wife of Jehoram, king of Judah ([2 Kings 8:18](/2kgs#2Kgs.8.18)), who “walked in the ways of the house of Ahab” ([2 Chr. 21:6](/2chr#2Chr.21.6)), called “daughter” of Omri ([2 Kings 8:26](/2kgs#2Kgs.8.26)). On the death of her husband and of her son Ahaziah, she resolved to seat herself on the vacant throne.

attai_363.name: Attai (Servant of jarha and his wife)

augustus_366.name: Augustus
augustus_366.bio: the cognomen of the first Roman emperor, C. Julius Caesar Octavianus, during whose reign Christ was born ( Luke 2:1 ). His decree that "all the world should be taxed" was the divinely ordered occasion of Jesus' being born, according to prophecy ( Micah 5:2 ), in Bethlehem.

azareel_370.name: Azareel (An Aaronite of the family of Korah)

azariah_376.name: Azariah (Son of Ethan)
azariah_376.bio: Son of Ethan, of the tribe of Judah ([1 Chr. 2:8](/1chr#1Chr.2.8)).

azariah_380.name: Azariah (First Indian bishop in the Anglican Chur)
azariah_380.bio: The son of Oded, a remarkable prophet in the days of Asa ([2 Chr. 15:1](/2chr#2Chr.15.1)). He stirred up the king and the people to a great national reformation.

azariah_382.name: Azariah (And he had brethren the sons of Jehoshap)

azariah_383.name: Azariah (one of the captains of Judah in the time)

azariah_385.name: Azariah (he that hears the Lord)
azariah_385.bio: High priest in the reign of Uzziah, king of Judah ([2 Kings 14:21](/2kgs#2Kgs.14.21); [2 Chr. 26:17-20](/2chr#2Chr.26.17)). He was contemporary with the prophets Isaiah, Amos, and Joel.

azariah_545.name: Azariah (Meshach)
azariah_545.bio: The original name of Abed-nego ([Dan. 1:6](/dan#Dan.1.6), [7](/dan#Dan.1.7), [11](/dan#Dan.1.11), [16](/dan#Dan.1.16)). He was of the royal family of Judah, and with his other two companions remarkable for his personal beauty and his intelligence as well as piety.

azaziah_547.name: Azaziah (A harper in the temple 1 Chronicles 15:2)
azaziah_547.bio: One of the Levitical harpers in the temple ([1 Chr. 15:21](/1chr#1Chr.15.21)).

azaziah_548.name: Azaziah (Hoshea son)
azaziah_548.bio: The father of Hoshea, who was made ruler over the Ephraimites ([1 Chr. 27:20](/1chr#1Chr.27.20)).

azaziah_549.name: Azaziah (Levite & Tithes Keeper)
azaziah_549.bio: One who had charge of the temple offerings ([2 Chr. 31:13](/2chr#2Chr.31.13)).

azel_551.name: Azel
azel_551.bio: Noble, a descendant of king Saul ([1 Chr. 8:37](/1chr#1Chr.8.37); [9:43](/1chr#1Chr.9.43), [44](/1chr#1Chr.9.44)).

azmaveth_555.name: Azmaveth (father of Jadah)
azmaveth_555.bio: One of David’s thirty warriors ([2 Sam. 23:31](/2sam#2Sam.23.31)).

azmaveth_557.name: Azmaveth (One of David's thirty warriors ( 2 Samue)

azmaveth_558.name: Azmaveth (son of Adiel)
azmaveth_558.bio: An overseer over the royal treasury in the time of David and Solomon ([1 Chr. 27:25](/1chr#1Chr.27.25)).

azriel_561.name: Azriel (Azrael is an angel in the Abrahamic reli)

azubah_567.name: Azubah (wife of Caleb)
azubah_567.bio: The daughter of Shilhi, and mother of king Jehoshaphat ([1 Kings 22:42](/1kgs#1Kgs.22.42)).

azur_569.name: Azur (r)
azur_569.bio: The father of Hananiah, a false prophet ([Jer. 28:1](/jer#Jer.28.1)).

azzur_572.name: Azzur
azzur_572.bio: One of those who sealed the covenant with Jehovah on the return from Babylon ([Neh. 10:17](/neh#Neh.10.17)).
